word:
(1896) E. from U.T. 8
     670. The animals are diseased, and by partaking of their flesh, we plant the seeds of disease in our own tissue and blood. Then when exposed to the changes in a malarious atmosphere, these are more sensibly felt; also when we are 
                                                                           387
exposed to prevailing epidemics and contagious diseases, the system is not in a condition to resist the disease.
